meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's me again, your go-to gal for all things groovy gaming. Today, I'm here to dish out the dirt on Chants of Sennaar, a puzzle adventure game that's got everyone in a tizzy. Well, almost everyone – more on that later.

Let me start by saying that Chants of Sennaar is a real trip. It's like someone took all the brain-teasing fun of puzzle games and mixed it with the linguistic flair of anthropology. Sounds weird? Trust me, it's not! The game drops you into a mystical world where ancient civilizations are waiting to be deciphered, one word at a time.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Puzzles, schmuzzles – how hard can it really be?" Well, let me tell you, Chants of Sennaar is no cakewalk. The puzzles require some serious linguistic legwork, but the payoff is worth it. When you finally crack that pesky code, it's like a rush of pride and accomplishment (or at least, that's what I keep telling myself – wink-wink).

The critics are all abuzz about this game, and for good reason. Slant Magazine gave it 70, saying it's an "interesting and impressive" game that feels more like a linguistic anthropology lesson than a puzzle adventure. Yeah, okay, Slant – you're not exactly the most exciting reviewer out there. I mean, who doesn't love a little academic flair in their gaming?

Worth Playing, on the other hand, gave it 80 and said it's "fascinating" with its "translation aspect." Translation, get it? Like, you have to translate ancient words to progress through the game? Yeah, yeah, yeah – I get it. The point is, Worth Playing liked it, and who am I to argue?

Now, SpazioGames gave Chants of Sennaar 80 as well, saying it's a "good" and "immersive" puzzle game with a lot of riddles to discover in a unique setting. Unique, huh? Like, ancient civilizations and mystical worlds – what's not to love?

God is a Geek chimed in with an 80, calling Chants of Sennaar one of the most unique and interesting puzzle games they've ever played. Routine genius moments, anyone? Okay, maybe that's just me.

Hardcore Gamer gave it a whopping 90, saying it "expertly captures the power of language" through its well-crafted cultures and intricate puzzles. Well, isn't that special?

And finally, TheSixthAxis and Noisy Pixel both gave Chants of Sennaar an 80, praising its engaging exploration of cultural relations and linguistic gameplay.

So, what's the verdict? In a nutshell (or a hippo shell, if you will), Chants of Sennaar is a puzzle adventure game that's got brains, brawn, and a whole lot of linguistic flair. If you're looking for something new and exciting to sink your teeth into, this might just be it.

And remember, folks – when in doubt, always go back to the hippo: Hippo Penny, where gaming meets groovy!
